oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Mantis visits the abode of the Ticks, attempts to take some of their food, and is well beaten by them. He flies away, goes into the water, and returns home where he is pitied and lectured by the Ichneumon. By /han=kasso (L VIII.-3. 6236-6258, 6267-6269). Also (L VIII.-20. 7790-7811; L VIII.-20. 7812-7816, 22. 7906-7956).
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Mantis and the Ticks
